name: widgets.AutomaticKeepAlive

methods.name: AutomaticKeepAlive
methods.desc: Creates a widget that listens to KeepAliveNotifications and maintains a KeepAlive widget appropriately.
methods.example:
Implementation

const AutomaticKeepAlive({
  Key key,
  this.child,
}) : super(key: key);

methods.name: createState
methods.desc:
Creates the mutable state for this widget at a given location in the tree.

Subclasses should override this method to return a newly created instance of their associated State subclass:

@override
_MyState createState() => _MyState();

The framework can call this method multiple times over the lifetime of a StatefulWidget. For example, if the widget is inserted into the tree in multiple locations, the framework will create a separate State object for each location. Similarly, if the widget is removed from the tree and later inserted into the tree again, the framework will call createState again to create a fresh State object, simplifying the lifecycle of State objects.

props.name: child
props.desc:
The widget below this widget in the tree.

This widget can only have one child. To lay out multiple children, let this widget's child be a widget such as Row, Column, or Stack, which have a children property, and then provide the children to that widget.

desc:
Allows subtrees to request to be kept alive in lazy lists.

This widget is like KeepAlive but instead of being explicitly configured, it listens to KeepAliveNotification messages from the child and other descendants.

The subtree is kept alive whenever there is one or more descendant that has sent a KeepAliveNotification and not yet triggered its KeepAliveNotification.handle.

To send these notifications, consider using AutomaticKeepAliveClientMixin.
